00001 package liquibase.change;

00010 import liquibase.util.StreamUtil;
00011 import liquibase.util.StringUtils;
00012 import liquibase.util.XMLUtil;

00014 import org.w3c.dom.NamedNodeMap;
00015 import org.w3c.dom.Node;
00016 import org.w3c.dom.NodeList;

00018 import javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilderFactory;
00019 import javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException;
00020 import java.io.IOException;
00021 import java.io.Writer;
00022 import java.util.*;
00023 
00030 public abstract class AbstractChange implements Change {
00031 
00032     /*
00033      * The name and the tag name of the change.
00034      * Defined as private members, so they can
00035      * only be accessed through accessor methods
00036      * by its subclasses
00037      */
00038     private final String changeName;
00039     private final String tagName;
00040     private FileOpener fileOpener;
00041 
00042     private ChangeSet changeSet;
00043 
00050     protected AbstractChange(String tagName, String changeName) {
00051         this.tagName = tagName;
00052         this.changeName = changeName;
00053     }
00054 
00055     //~ ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- public interface
00056 
00057     public ChangeSet getChangeSet() {
00058         return changeSet;
00059     }

00061     public void setChangeSet(ChangeSet changeSet) {
00062         this.changeSet = changeSet;
00063     }

00069         return changeName;
00070     }

00075     public String getTagName() {
00076         return tagName;

00078 
00082     public void executeStatements(Database database) throws JDBCException, UnsupportedChangeException {
00083         SqlStatement[] statements = generateStatements(database);
00084 
00085         execute(statements, database);
00086     }
00087 
00091     public void saveStatements(Database database, Writer writer) throws IOException, UnsupportedChangeException, StatementNotSupportedOnDatabaseException {
00092         SqlStatement[] statements = generateStatements(database);
00093         for (SqlStatement statement : statements) {
00094             writer.append(statement.getSqlStatement(database)).append(statement.getEndDelimiter(database)).append(StreamUtil.getLineSeparator()).append(StreamUtil.getLineSeparator());
00095         }
00096     }
00097 
00101     public void executeRollbackStatements(Database database) throws JDBCException, UnsupportedChangeException, RollbackImpossibleException {
00102         SqlStatement[] statements = generateRollbackStatements(database);
00103         execute(statements, database);
00104     }
00105 
00109     public void saveRollbackStatement(Database database, Writer writer) throws IOException, UnsupportedChangeException, RollbackImpossibleException, StatementNotSupportedOnDatabaseException {
00110         SqlStatement[] statements = generateRollbackStatements(database);
00111         for (SqlStatement statement : statements) {
00112             writer.append(statement.getSqlStatement(database)).append(";\n\n");
00113         }
00114     }
00115 
00116     /*
00117      * Skipped by this skeletal implementation
00118      *
00119      * @see liquibase.change.Change#generateStatements(liquibase.database.Database)
00120      */
00121 
00125     public SqlStatement[] generateRollbackStatements(Database database) throws UnsupportedChangeException, RollbackImpossibleException {
00126         return generateRollbackStatementsFromInverse(database);
00127     }
00128 
00132     public boolean canRollBack() {
00133         return createInverses() != null;
00134     }
00135 
00136     /*
00137      * Skipped by this skeletal implementation
00138      *
00139      * @see liquibase.change.Change#getConfirmationMessage()
00140      */
00141 
00142     /*
00143      * Skipped by this skeletal implementation
00144      *
00145      * @see liquibase.change.Change#createNode(org.w3c.dom.Document)
00146      */
00147 
00151     public String getMD5Sum() {
00152         try {
00153             StringBuffer buffer = new StringBuffer();
00154             nodeToStringBuffer(createNode(DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance().newDocumentBuilder().newDocument()), buffer);
00155             return MD5Util.computeMD5(buffer.toString());
00156         } catch (ParserConfigurationException e) {
00157             throw new RuntimeException(e);
00158         }
00159     }
00160 
00161     //~ ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- private methods
00162     /*
00163      * Generates rollback statements from the inverse changes returned by createInverses()
00164      *
00165      * @param database the target {@link Database} associated to this change's rollback statements
00166      * @return an array of {@link String}s containing the rollback statements from the inverse changes
00167      * @throws UnsupportedChangeException if this change is not supported by the {@link Database} passed as argument
00168      * @throws RollbackImpossibleException if rollback is not supported for this change
00169      */
00170     private SqlStatement[] generateRollbackStatementsFromInverse(Database database) throws UnsupportedChangeException, RollbackImpossibleException {
00171         Change[] inverses = createInverses();
00172         if (inverses == null) {
00173             throw new RollbackImpossibleException("No inverse to " + getClass().getName() + " created");
00174         }
00175 
00176         List<SqlStatement> statements = new ArrayList<SqlStatement>();
00177 
00178         for (Change inverse : inverses) {
00179             statements.addAll(Arrays.asList(inverse.generateStatements(database)));
00180         }
00181 
00182         return statements.toArray(new SqlStatement[statements.size()]);
00183     }
00184 
00185     /*
00186      * Create inverse changes that can roll back this change. This method is intended
00187      * to be overriden by the subclasses that can create inverses.
00188      *
00189      * @return an array of {@link Change}s containing the inverse
00190      *         changes that can roll back this change
00191      */
00192     protected Change[] createInverses() {
00193         return null;
00194     }
00195 
00196     /*
00197      * Creates a {@link String} using the XML element representation of this
00198      * change
00199      *
00200      * @param node the {@link Element} associated to this change
00201      * @param buffer a {@link StringBuffer} object used to hold the {@link String}
00202      *               representation of the change
00203      */
00204     private void nodeToStringBuffer(Element node, StringBuffer buffer) {
00205         buffer.append("<").append(node.getNodeName());
00206         SortedMap<String, String> attributeMap = new TreeMap<String, String>();
00207         NamedNodeMap attributes = node.getAttributes();
00208         for (int i = 0; i < attributes.getLength(); i++) {
00209             Node attribute = attributes.item(i);
00210             attributeMap.put(attribute.getNodeName(), attribute.getNodeValue());
00211         }
00212         for (Map.Entry entry : attributeMap.entrySet()) {
00213             String value = (String) entry.getValue();
00214             if (value != null) {
00215                 buffer.append(" ").append(entry.getKey()).append("=\"").append(attributeMap.get(value)).append("\"");
00216             }
00217         }
00218         buffer.append(">").append(StringUtils.trimToEmpty(XMLUtil.getTextContent(node)));
00219         NodeList childNodes = node.getChildNodes();
00220         for (int i = 0; i < childNodes.getLength(); i++) {
00221             Node childNode = childNodes.item(i);
00222             if (childNode instanceof Element) {
00223                 nodeToStringBuffer(((Element) childNode), buffer);
00224             }
00225         }
00226         buffer.append("</").append(node.getNodeName()).append(">");
00227     }
00228 
00229     /*
00230      * Executes the statements passed as argument to a target {@link Database}
00231      *
00232      * @param statements an array containing the SQL statements to be issued
00233      * @param database the target {@link Database}
00234      * @throws JDBCException if there were problems issuing the statements
00235      */
00236     private void execute(SqlStatement[] statements, Database database) throws JDBCException {
00237         for (SqlStatement statement : statements) {
00238             LogFactory.getLogger().finest("Executing Statement: " + statement);
00239             database.getJdbcTemplate().execute(statement);
00240         }
00241     }
00242

00248         this.fileOpener = fileOpener;
00249     }
00250     
00256     public FileOpener getFileOpener() {
00257         return fileOpener;
00258     }

00265         
00266     }
